sec.p: The global occurrences of M. peltata have been reported between 27°N and 25°S (Australia's Virtual Herbarium 2009, PIER, 2009, GBIF, 2010). Consequently, the southern and northern limits of M. peltata's global distribution were defined using two cold stress mechanisms. The cold stress temperature threshold (TTCS) was set at 10°C with the stress accumulation rate (THCS) set at −0.003 week −1 while the Cold‐Stress Degree‐day Threshold (DTCS) was set at 20°C days, with the stress accumulation rate (DHCS) set at −0.003 week −1. These two mechanisms ensured that the potential distribution was restricted to the known northern and southern limits (Taylor et al. 2012b).
